meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or noise, especially that made by metal striking metal.
meanings.sent1: The clangour of the hammer hitting the anvil echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The clangour of the church bells could be heard throughout the entire village.
meanings.sent3: The clangour of the pots and pans clashing together in the kitchen startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The clangour of the metal gates closing behind him symbolized the end of his freedom.
meanings.sent5: The clangour of the gong marked the beginning of the ceremony with a powerful sound.

meanings.sent1: The sudden clangour of the cymbals startled the audience.
meanings.sent2: The clangour of the car crash could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent3: The clangour of the metal door slamming shut made her jump.
meanings.sent4: The clangour of the alarm clock in the morning was like a rude awakening.
meanings.sent5: The clangour of the metal gate closing behind him echoed in the empty alleyway.
